Unnamed: 1: D&N Haveli And Daman And Diu

Unnamed: 8:
Cases  were  reported  from  Village  Kakotitup,  Sub-District Naobaicha,  District  Lakhimpur.  Cases  presented  with  fever headache,   nausea   and   weakness.   4   blood   samples   were collected   and   sent  to   DPHL   Lakhimpur.   1   sample   came positive   for   Leptospira   IgM   by   ELISA.   District   RRT investigated       the       outbreak.       Cases       were       treated symptomatically. Community awareness and health education
given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases    were    reported    from    Vilwadri    Tution    Centre, Kuthampully, Sub-District Talappilly, District Thrissur. Cases presented with fever with rash. District RRT investigated the outbreak.  Age  group  of  the  affected  cases  were  13-15  years. Cases  were  treated  symptomatically.  Community  awareness
and health education given by peripheral team on vaccination, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Villages Kenmynsaw  and Kenbah, Sub-District    Mawsynram,    District    East    Khasi    Hills.. Cases  presented  with  fever  with  rash,  cough,  coryza  and conjunctivitis.  6  throat  swab  and  blood  samples  were  tested. Samples  came  positive  for  Measles  IgM  by  ELISA.  District RRT  investigated  the  outbreak.  Age  group  of  the  affected cases  were  1-16  years.  Cases  were  treated  symptomatically. Vitamin A solution were given to them. Immunization history was poor.   Community awareness and health education given
by  peripheral  team  on  vaccination,  hygiene  and  sanitation. 6Y/M expired on 8-01-2024.

Cases   were   reported   from   Maskut   Village,   Sub-District Thadlaskein, District West Jaintia Hills. Cases presented with fever  with  rash.  5  blood  samples  were  collected  and  sent  to Guwahati  Medical  College.  All  5  samples  came  positive  for the  Measles  IgM  by  ELISA.  District  RRT  investigated  the outbreak.  Age  group  of  the  affected  cases  were  1-24  years. Cases were treated symptomatically. Vitamin A solution were given   to   them.   Three   of   the   cases   were   immunized. Community   awareness   and    health   education    given    by
peripheral team on vaccination, hygiene and sanitation.

Case  was  reported  from  Sub-District  Laskein,  District  West Jaintia Hills. A 6 year old female presented with complaints of fever, hydrophobia, and aerophobia. History of dog bite on the 2nd week of Dec, 2023. She reported to UPHC Nongthymmai for  ARV.  District  RRT  investigated  the  outbreak.  The  dog died on the same day of incident. She expired on 12 January 2024.  Community  awareness  and  health  education  given  by
peripheral  team  on  vaccination  for  dog  bite,  hygiene  and sanitation.

Cases  were reported  from Village:  R.V. Nagar, Sub-District: Gudem Kotha Veedhi, District: Alluri Sitharama Raju. Cases presented with loose stools after consumption of food in a social gathering.   All   age   groups   were   affected.   District   RRT investigated  the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and  health education given by peripheral team on personal hygiene, hand washing   techniques   and   using   clean   drinking   water   and utensils. ORS packets were disbursed and medical camp was
set  up  for  monitoring.  The  outbreak  might  be  caused  by consumption of improperly cooked spoiled meat.

Cases were reported from UPHC Sarada Colony Guntur, UHC IPD  Colony  Guntur,  UHC  Lanchester  Road  Guntru,  Sub- District:  Guntur  East,  District:  Guntur.  Cases  presented  with loose stools & vomiting. Total 150 stool samples were collected and sent to Microbiology Lab GMC, out of which 2 samples were positive for cholera on culture. Also, 1075 water samples were  collected  and  sent  to  the  Regional  Lab  Guntur,  out  of which 979 were satisfactory for potable purpose. District RRT investigated  the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and  health education  given  by  peripheral  health  team  on  hygiene,  and sanitation.  Medical  camps  were  organised.  House  to  house survey was done. Health education was given & awareness was given  on  diarrhea,  and  personal  hygiene.    Protected  water supply  was  provided.  Regular  collection  of  water  samples  at Municipal Over Head Tanks was done and packaged drinking water was supplied, sanitation rectification of leakages of pipe lines were made. Death of an 18 year old female has occurred
10.02.2024 at GGH Guntur due to the illness (cholera positive).

Cases  were  reported  from  UPHC  Sarada  Colony  Guntur, Mandapadu,   UPHC   Rajiv   Gandhi   Nagar   (Reddipalem), Medikondur,      Village:      Perecharla      II,       Sub-District: Medikonduru,  District:  Guntur.  Cases  presented  with  loose stools.  Total  150  stool  samples  were  collected  &  sent  to Microbiology Lab GMC Guntur, out of which 2 were positive for cholera on culture. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community   awareness   and    health   education    given    by peripheral  health  team  on  hygiene,  and  sanitation.  House  to house survey was conducted. Sanitation measures were done in the surrounding areas. People were advised to consume boiled
and  then cooled  water. Health  awareness  created  on cholera. Protected drinking water supply to the area was given.

Cases were reported from Health Facility: Chhindnar, Village: Kasoli, Sub-District: Gidam. Cases presented with fever with rash.  All  cases  were  below  10  years.  Total  28  urine,  blood samples  and  oral  swabs  were  collected  &  sent  to  AIIMS, Raipur,  out  of  which  16  were  positive  for  Mumps  IgM  by ELISA.  District  RRT  investigated  the  outbreak.  Community awareness  and  health  education  given  by peripheral  team  on
hygiene  and  sanitation.  Vitamin  A given  and  home  isolation advised.

Case  was  reported  from  UPHC  Kolua,  Sub-District:  Huzur, District: Bhopal. Case presented with fever which was found positive        for        Leptospirosis        IgM        by        ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and  health  education  given  by  peripheral  health  team  on hygiene, and  sanitation. Health education imparted  regarding the spread of disease. Active fever surveillance was done. IEC regarding Do's & Don’ts of Leptospirosis was done. Death of a
61 year old male has occurred due to the illness.

Case was reported from UPHC Kolua, District: Bhopal. Case presented                                   with                                   fever & jaundice and  was found positive for Leptospirosis  IgM by ELISA  during  treatment  in  Bansal  hospital.  District  RRT investigated  the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and  health education  given  by  peripheral  health  team  on  hygiene,  and sanitation. Health education imparted regarding the spread of disease.  Active  fever  surveillance  was  done.  IEC  regarding Do's  &  Don’ts  of  Leptospirosis  was  done.  One  death  has occurred  due to the illness.  Death of a  40  year old  male  has
occurred due to the illness.

Cases were reported from Sub-District Arjunda, District Balod. Cases presented with fever with rash. All cases were diagnosed clinically. The most affected age group was 3-12 years. District RRT    investigated    the    outbreak.    Cases    were    treated symptomatically. Community awareness and health education
given   by   peripheral   team   on   vaccination,   hygiene   and sanitation.

Cases   were   reported   from   UPHC   Labhandi,   Sub-District Raipur,  District  Raipur.  Cases  presented  with  loose  stools. Health camp was organized and door to door survey was started in the area. Most affected age group was 17 to 50 years. Water samples for bacteriological test were unsatisfactory for drinking and eight stool samples were sent to Hamar Lab Pandri, out of which Vibrio cholerae was found  in three samples. Six stool samples were also sent to JNM Medical College Raipur, which were  found  to  be  negative  for  any  pathogen.  District  RRT investigated  the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and  health
education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases   were   reported   from   CHC   Jamjodhpur   and   UHC Jamjodhpur,  Village  Gandheshvar  Vadi  Vistar  Jamjodhpur, District Jamnagar. Cases presented  with fever  with rash. The affected age group was 28 days to 1 year.  All the cases were unvaccinated  for  measles.  Five  samples  were  sent  to  B.J. Medical College Asarva, out of which 3 were positive for Anti- Measles   IgM   by   ELISA.   District   RRT   investigated   the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by
peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases   were   reported   from   Sub-District   Kochi,   District Ernakulam. Cases of same family presented with fever, nausea and  vomiting.  4  blood  samples  and  3  water  sample  were collected and sent to RPHL Ernakulam. All four samples came positive  for  Hepatitis  A IgM  by  ELISA.  Water  found  fit  for potable purpose. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were   treated   symptomatically.   Community   awareness   and
health  education  given  by  peripheral  team  on  hygiene  and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Village Ramatheertham, Sub-District Banaganapalle,  District  Nandyal.  Cases  presented  with  loose stools and vomiting. 3 water samples were collected and sent to Regional Public Health Lab, Kurnool. 2 water samples found unfit  for  potable  purpose  (Klebsiella  detected).  District  RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. A 50 year old female expired on 15-05-2024 due to GE with
Septicemic shock. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  Village  Yerraguntla,  Sub-District Bandi Atmakur, District Nandyal. Cases presented with loose stools.  8  water  samples  were  collected  and  sent  to  Regional Public Health Lab, Kurnool. 4  water samples found unfit for potable     purpose     (Klebsiella     detected).     District     RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically.
Community   awareness   and    health   education    given    by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  Village  Virapuram,  Sub-District Konta, District Sukma. Cases presented with loose stools and vomiting. 4 stool samples and 18 water samples were collected and  sent  to  Jagdalpur  Medical  College  and  PHE  lab  Sukma respectively. E. Coli detected in one stool sample, all the water samples    found    fit    for    potable    purpose.    District    RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. Community   awareness   and    health   education    given    by
peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  Sub-District  Chalakkudy,  District Thrissur.  Cases  presented  with  loose  stools  and  vomiting. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All the cases developed the  symptoms  after  having  food  at  a  marriage  function  at Koratty.   They   were   treated   symptomatically.   Community awareness  and  health  education  given  by peripheral  team  on
hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Village Nimmi, Sub-District Sausar, District Chhindwara. Cases presented  with fever  with rash. 1 blood  sample  was  collected  and  sent  to  NIRTH,  Jabalpur. Sample came positive for the Measles IgM by ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Age group of the affected cases was 14-50 Cases treated symptomatically. Vitamin A solution was given to them. Community awareness and health education
given   by   peripheral   team   on   vaccination,   hygiene   and sanitation.

Cases   were  reported   from  Sub-District   Depalpur,   District Indore.  Cases  presented  with  fever.  35  blood  samples  were collected  and  sent  to  CHC  Depalpur  and  DPHL  Indore.  All samples came negative for the Dengue NS1 antigen by ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases symptomatically. Community   awareness   and    health   education    given    by peripheral  team  on  vector  control  measures,  hygiene,  and
sanitation.

Cases were reported from Village Kodoli, Sub-District Panhala, District Kolhapur. Cases presented with fever with joint pain. 18 blood samples were collected and sent to SSHRCSMGMC Kolhapur. 8 samples came positive for the Chikungunya IgM by  ELISA.  District  RRT  investigated  the  outbreak.  Cases symptomatically. Community awareness and health education
given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene, and sanitation.

Cases   were   reported   from   Village   Namdong   and   other neighboring  villages,  Sub-District Thadlaskein, District West Jaintia Hills. Cases presented with fever with parotid swelling. District  RRT  investigated  the  outbreak.  Age  group  of  the affected cases was 3-29 years. Cases treated symptomatically. Community   awareness   and    health   education    given    by
peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Case was reported from Village Lakroh, Sub-District Amlarem, District West Jaintia Hills. A 30 year-old female presented with complaints     of     fever,     headache,     confusion,     agitation, hydrophobia and aerophobia. History of dog bite on 17th March 2024.  She  did  not  receive  RIG  immediately.  District  RRT investigated   the   outbreak.   She   expired   on   06-05-2024. Community   awareness   and    health   education    given    by
peripheral  team  on  vaccination  for  dog  bite,  hygiene  and sanitation.

Case   was   reported   from   Village   Muktapur,   Sub-District Amlarem,  District  West  Jaintia  Hills.  A  33  year-old  male presented with complaints of fever, headache, muscle spasm, hydrophobia  and  aerophobia.  Historie  of  dog  bite  2  months back.  He  did  not  receive  post  exposure  prophylaxis.  RIG immediately.   District   RRT   investigated   the   outbreak.   He expired  on  04-05-2024.  Community  awareness  and  health
education given by peripheral team on vaccination for dog bite, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases   were   reported   from   Village   Nipan,   Sub-District Garautha, District Jhansi. Cases presented with fever with rash. 5 blood samples were collected and sent to SGPGI, Lucknow. All the samples came positive for the Measles IgM by ELISA. District  RRT  investigated  the  outbreak.  Age  group  of  the affected cases was 5-15 years. Cases treated symptomatically. Vitamin A solution was given to susceptible one. Community awareness  and  health  education  given  by peripheral  team  on
vaccination, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases   were   reported   from   Sub-District   Mathura,   District Mathura. Cases presented with loose stools, vomiting and pain abdomen. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. All the cases developed the symptoms after  having  food  in  a  restaurant.  Community awareness  and health  education  given  by  peripheral  team  on  hygiene  and
sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  Village  Dirghagram,  Sub-District Ghatal,  District  Medinipur  West.  Cases  presented  with  loose stools,  vomiting.  2  stool  samples  and  2  water  samples  were collected and sent to Midnapur Medical College and PHE lab, Midnapur respectively. Stool sample did not show growth of any pathogenic organism, water samples found unfit for potable purpose.  District  RRT  investigated  the  outbreak.  Cases  were treated  symptomatically.  Community  awareness  and  health
education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases   were   reported   from   PHC   K.V.B.Puram,   Village: Katrapalle,   Sub-District:   K.V.B.   Puram,   District:   Tirupati. Cases  presented  with  diarrhea.  Eight  water  samples  were collected  and  sent  to RWS department, all  were found  to be satisfactory.   One  stool   sample  was  collected  and  sent  to SVMC,  Tirupathi,  which  showed  no  growth.  District  RRT investigated  the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and  health
education  given  by  peripheral  team  on  control  measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  a  hostel  under  V.H.C.  Chennur, Village:  Chennuru  –  II  (Part),  Sub-District:  Gudur,  District: Tirupati. Cases are presented with diarrhea.
Four  water  samples  were  collected  and  sent to  RWS,  out  of which   1  was   positive   for   E.coli.   One   stool   sample   was collected  and  sent  to  Department  of  Microbiology,  SVMC, Tirupathi,  which  was  positive  for  V.  cholerae.  District  RRT investigated  the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and  health education  given  by  peripheral  team  on  control  measures,
hygiene and sanitation.

Cases      reported      from      Pandomatti      PHC,      Village: Rajagonddanahalli Thanda, Sub-District: Channagiri, District: Davangere.  Cases  presented  with  loose  stool  and  vomiting. All age groups were affected. Two stool and 19 water samples were collected and tested at SIMS Shivamogga & Pandomatti PHC.   Stool   samples   showed   no   growth   of   any   entero- pathogens.    Out  of  19  water  samples,  11  were  found  to  be NSPP   (not   suitable   for   potable   purpose).     District   RRT investigated  the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and  health education  given  by  peripheral  team  on  control  measures,
hygiene and sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  a  school  under  FHC  Chingoli, Village: Chingoli (CT), Sub-District: Karthikappally, District: Alappuzha.  Cases  presented  with  loose  stool,  nausea,  fever, myalgia,  abdominal  pain  and  vomiting.  Three  rectal  swabs were sent to NIV Alapuzha,  out of which  1 was positive for Noro virus  by PCR.  Five  water  samples  were sent  for  water quality  tests,  which  showed  presence  of  Coliforms.  District RRT  investigated  the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and health   education   given   by   peripheral   team   on   control
measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  a  school  under  FHC  Pariyaram, Village:   Athirappally,   Sub-District:   Chalakkudy,   District: Thrissur. Cases presented with fever  with  vesicular rash. The affected  age  group  was  6-9  years.  Cases  were  diagnosed clinically. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health  education  given  by peripheral  team on control  measures,  hygiene  and  sanitation.  Isolation  of  the
cases was done.

Cases  were  reported  from  Malshiras  PHC,  Village:  Saswad Rural,    Sub-District:    Purandhar,    District:   Pune.       Cases presented with fever  with rash. Total 27 serum samples were collected & sent to NIV Pune, out of which 1 was positive for Zika   RT-PCR.   District   RRT   investigated   the   outbreak. Community   awareness    and   health    education    given    by
peripheral  team  on   vector   control  measures,  hygiene  and sanitation.

Cases reported from  a school  under  PHC  Kakching Khunou, Sub-District:  Waikhong,  District:  Kakching.  Cases  presented with loose motion, vomiting & fever. All samples were negative for any entero-pathogen. District RRT investigated  the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and  health education  given  by  peripheral  team  on  control  measures,
hygiene and sanitation.

Cases   reported   from   PHC   Leisangthem   under   Thoubal District.  Cases  presented  with  parotitis,  fever.  The  affected age group was 5-14 years. All cases were diagnosed clinically. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and  health  education  given  by  peripheral  team  on  control
measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases reported from Health  Facility: Balaramprasad, Village: Bahalsahi, Sub-District: Chhendipada, District: Anugul. Cases presented  with  fever.  The affected  age  group  was  5-9  years. Community  awareness  and  health  education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene

Cases    reported    from    Village:    Sirimaska,    Sub-District: Thuamul  Rampur,  District:  Kalahandi.  Cases  presented  with fever, runny nose. The affected age group was 2-34 years. Community   awareness    and   health    education    given    by peripheral team on control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Case  was  reported  from  Haorangsabul  under  PHC  Phayeng, Sub-District       Lamphelpat,       District       Imphal       West. Cases  were  reported  from  Village  Ulihatu,  Sub-District  Erki (Tamar  II),  District  Khunti.  Cases  presented  with  fever  with rash. Age group of the affected cases were 8-15  years. Cases were reported from Visnagar UPHC, PHC Kansa, PHC Kansaraku,  Village:  Savala,  Sub-District:  Visnagar,  District: Mahesana. Cases presented with fever with rash. RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral  team  on  hygiene  and  sanitation.  Vitamin  A  was

Cases   were   reported   from   a   school   in   Vadakkethara, Pazhayannur,  FHC  Elanad,  Sub-Centre  Pazhayannur  under Pazhayannur Gram Panchayat. Instructions were given to school authority  for  continued  surveillance  to  be  maintained  so  that
cases   are   identified,   contacts   are   traced,   and   informed implementation of appropriate infection control measures.

education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Village Thodiyoor (CT), Sub-District Karunagappally,  District  Kollam.  Cases  presented  with  fever with throat pain. District RRT investigated the outbreak. given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Village Dangra Kuwan, Sub-District Datia,  District  Datia.  Cases  presented  with  fever,  pain  in salivary gland and muscles pain. 1 blood and swab sample were collected and sent to ICMR-NIRTH, Jabalpur. It came negative. District  RRT  investigated  the  outbreak.  Cases  were  treated symptomatically.  Age  group  of  the  affected  cases  were  2-30 years.  Community  awareness  and  health  education  given  by
peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from a ladies hostel, PHC Sugandhagiri, THQH    Vythiri,    Village:    Kunnathidavaka,    Sub-District: Vythiri, District: Wayanad. Cases presented with symptoms of loose stool, nausea, vomiting, and abdominal pain. Three stool samples were collected and sent to NIV-Alappuzha for further analysis,  which  were  negative  for  Noro,  Rota,  and  Entero viruses.  Well  and  water  purifier  samples  were  sent  them  to KWA  (Kerala  Water  Authority)  Kalpetta  for  analysis.  The results revealed the presence of E. coli and coliform bacteria in the well water, as well as coliform bacteria in the water from the    purifier.    District    RRT    investigated    the    outbreak.
Community   awareness   and    health   education    given    by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  PHC  Chachura,  Village:  Murela, Sub-District: Chachaura, District: Guna. Cases presented with symptoms of fever with rash and cough, coryza. Total 12 serum samples were sent to GMC Bhopal, out of which 1 was positive for Anti- Measles IgM by ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by
peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from PHC Fatehgarh, Village: Panchora, Sub-District:  Bamori,  District:  Guna.  Cases  presented  with symptoms of fever with rash and cough, coryza. Total 12 serum samples were sent to GMC Bhopal, out of which 1 was positive for Anti-Measles IgM by ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by
peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases   reported   from  Village   Asgaon,   Block   Pauni,   PHC Asgaon,   SC   Asgaon.   Cases   presented   with   symptoms   of abdominal pain, nausea, dysentery. The affected age group was 6-70  years.  Food  samples  were  sent  to  RPHL  Nagpur  for investigation.    District    RRT    investigated    the    outbreak. Community   awareness   and    health   education    given    by
peripheral health team on hygiene, and sanitation.

Cases    were    reported    from    PHC    Vetlapalem,    Village: Vetlapalem,   Sub-District:   Samalkota,   District:   Kakinada. Cases  presented  with  diarrhea.  A  total  of  15  water  samples were  collected  and  sent  to  RPHL,  Visakhapatnam,  out  of which  8  were  positive  for  Klebsiella  and  1  was  positive  for E.coli.  District  RRT  investigated  the  outbreak.  Community awareness and health  education  given  by peripheral  team on
control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases   were   reported   from   Health   Facility:   Gudibanda, Village:  Kaki,  Sub-District:  Rolla,  District:  Sri  Sathya  Sai. Cases  presented  with  loose  motions  and  vomiting.  Water  & stool samples were sent for testing, all were negative for any entero-pathogen.   District   RRT   investigated   the   outbreak. Community   awareness    and   health    education    given    by
peripheral team on control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases reported from Village Lakhamapur, Block Dindori, SC Lakhamapur,  PHC  Varkheda.  Cases  presented  with  fever, vomiting,  headache.  Seven  blood  samples  were  collected  & sent to District Priority Lab,  out of which 1 was positive for Dengue   IgM   by   ELISA.   District   RRT   investigated   the outbreak.  Community  awareness  and  health  education  given by  peripheral  team  on  vector  control  measures,  hygiene  and
sanitation. Death of a 79 year old male has occurred due to the illness (Dengue positive).

Cases  reported  from  Mangalwar  Peth  area,  UCHC  Kamla Nehru  Hosp.  Pune.  Cases  presented  with  nausea,  vomiting, and  abdominal  pain.  All  age  groups  were  affected.  Total  24 serum samples were collected & sent to KEM Hospital, out of which  14  were  positive  for  Typhoid  by  Widal  test.  District RRT  investigated  the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and health   education   given   by   peripheral   team   on   control
measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases  reported  from  Village  Jite,  Block  Pen,  SC  Jite,  PHC Jite. Cases presented with  fever. Total 5 blood samples were collected & sent to District Hospital lab Alibag, out of which 2 were positive for Dengue NS1 Ag by ELISA. District RRT investigated  the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and  health education   given   by   peripheral   team   on   vector   control
measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases reported from Nongdom–B Village under Kynshi PHC, Mairang  block.  Cases  presented  with  vomiting,  abdominal pain,  and  loose  stools  after  attending  a  death  ceremony  on August  28,  2024.  Food  samples  were  collected  and  sent  for investigation   by   the   Food   Safety   Officer.   District   RRT investigated  the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and  health education  given  by  peripheral  team  on  control  measures,
hygiene and sanitation.

Cases    reported    from    Dhamnagar    CHC,    Sub-District: Dhamanagar,  District:  Bhadrak.  Cases  presented  with  loose motion with vomiting. The affected age group was 6-40 years. Four  rectal  swab  &  8  water  samples  were  sent  to  DPHL Bhadrak. No entero-pathogenic organism was found in rectal swabs  on  culture.  Water  samples  were  OT<0.1  PPM,  H2S positive.  District RRT  investigated  the outbreak. Community
awareness and health  education  given  by peripheral  team on control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  Mohammadiya  Arabic  College, Rayadurgam, Sub-District Rayadurg, District Anantapur. Cases presented  with  pain  abdomen,  loose  stools  and  vomiting. District  RRT  investigated  the  outbreak.  Cases  were  treated symptomatically.  All the cases developed the symptoms after consuming street food on 07-06-2024. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on hygiene and
sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  Nursing  Kaushal  College,  Sub- District Latehar, District Latehar.  Cases presented  with fever with rash. 5  blood samples were collected and sent to  RIMS Ranchi.    It  came  negative  for  the  Measles  IgM  by  ELISA. District    RRT    investigated    the    outbreak.    Cases    treated symptomatically.  Age  group  of  the  cases  was  17-23  years. Community   awareness   and    health   education    given    by
peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  wards  17  and  28  of  Guruvayur Municipality , Sub-District Chavakkad, District Thrissur. Cases presented  with  fever.  265  blood  samples  were  collected  and sent  to  DMO lab  Thrissur. 29  samples came positive  for  the Dengue NS1 by ELISA, 10 came positive for Dengue IgM by ELISA  and  226  for  Dengue  NS1  by  RDTs.  District  RRT investigated   the   outbreak.   Cases   treated   symptomatically. Community   awareness   and    health   education    given    by peripheral  team  on  vector  control  measures,  hygiene,  and
sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  village  Pariyaram,  Sub-District Chalakkudy,  District  Thrissur.  Cases  presented  with  loose stools, pain abdomen, vomiting and fever. Total  3 food samples and  1  water  sample  were  collected  and  sent  to  Regional Analytical   lab,   Kakkanad,   Kochi.   Food   samples   found satisfactory while water sample found unfit for potable purpose. District   RRT   investigated   the   outbreak.   Cases      treated symptomatically. Community awareness and health education
given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases   reported   from   Kommanapalli   Village   under   PHC A.V.Nagaram,  District:  Kakinada.  Cases  presented  with  pain abdomen, vomiting, and loose stools. Nine water samples were collected  and  sent to  RPHL,  Visakhapatnam,  out of  which  4 were found to be bacteriologically unsatisfactory for drinking. Two stool samples were collected and sent to RMC, Kakinada, out  of  which  1  was  positive  for  Vibrio  cholera  on  culture. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness
and  health  education  given  by  peripheral  team  on  control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases  reported  from  Village:  Sapmari,  Bhurbandha  BPHC. Cases presented with symptoms of vomiting, abdominal pain, and diarrhea after attending a feast. Three stool samples were collected & sent to DPHL, Morigaon, all showed no growth on culture.  District  RRT  investigated  the  outbreak.  Community awareness  and  health  education  given  by peripheral  team  on
control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Sub-District Khunti, District Khunti. Cases  presented  with  fever.  Total  27  blood  samples  were collected and sent to RIMS Ranchi, out of which 24 samples were positive for Dengue NS1 antigen (11 samples) and IgM (13   samples)   by   ELISA.   District   RRT   investigated   the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by
peripheral  team  on  vector  control  measures,  hygiene,  and sanitation. An 11 year old girl child expired due to the illness.

Case  was  reported  from  Village  Salwe,  Sub-District  Garu, District   Latehar.   A  10-year-old   girl   child   presented   with complaints of  fever,  hydrophobia and  aerophobia. History of dog bite one  month back.  ARV  was  not taken. District RRT investigated  the  outbreak.  The  case  was  referred  to  RIMS, Ranchi and further to Infectious Disease hospital. She expired on  02-06-2024  at  home.  Community  awareness  and  health
education given by peripheral team on vaccination for dog bite, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  Village  Bara  Basko  under  Health Facility Amrapara, District Pakur. Cases presented with loose stools,  vomiting.  District  RRT  investigated  the  outbreak.  All the cases were treated symptomatically. Community awareness
and health education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases   were   reported   from   Village   Dariapur,   Sub-District Barhait, District Sahebganj. Cases presented with loose stools, vomiting. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All the cases were   treated   symptomatically.   Community   awareness   and health  education  given  by  peripheral  team  on  hygiene  and
sanitation.

Cases  reported  from  Nittur  PHC,  Village:  Yalagunda,  Sub- District: Hassan, District: Hassan. Cases presented  with non- healing wound at upper right shoulder & history of category 3 dog bite at the same site on 26.04.2024. Patient received 3 doses of ARV from Nittur PHC. Post  mortem brain biopsy sample was tested at NIMHANS, which was positive for Rabies by RT- PCR.  District  RRT  investigated  the  outbreak.  IEC  activities regarding wound washing, wood management, importance of ARV  in  animal  bite  condition  and  completing  the  vaccine schedule   was   conducted.   Contact   tracing   was   done   and exposure prophylaxis was started for all 11 close contacts. The patient,  a  76  year  old  female  and  a  known  case  of  diabetes, succumbed to the injuries on 18.05.2024 during treatment from
NIMHANS, Bengaluru.

Cases were reported from a hostel under UPHC Malappuram (Panakad),  THQH  Malappuram,  Village:  Majalguda,  Sub- District:  Ernad,  District:  Malappuram.  Cases  presented  with symptoms  of  loose  stools  after  consumption  of  food  from  a common  kitchen.  Four  stool  samples  were  sent  to  MCH Kozhikode, all were negative for any entero-pathogen. District RRT  investigated  the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and health education given by peripheral team on control measures,
hygiene and sanitation. Area was under surveillance.

Cases  reported  from  Sunwara  Village,  PHC  Sunwara,  Sub- District:   Dhanora,   District:   Seoni.   Cases   presented   with symptoms of vomiting and loose motion. Three stool samples were collected and sent to Chhindwara Medical College. Water sample was sent to PHE department. District RRT investigated the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and  health  education given  by  peripheral  team  on  control  measures,  hygiene  and
sanitation.

Cases were reported from Dr B R Ambedkar Residential School Aadivarapupeta,       Village       Draksharama,       Sub-District Drakhsharama, Ramachandrapuram AH, District Konaseema. Cases  presented  with  abdominal  pain,  nausea,  loose  motions and vomiting. Stool samples, water samples and food samples were  collected  and  sent  to  RMC  Kakinada.  Samples  did  not show   growth   of   any   pathogenic   organism.   District   RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. All  the  cases  developed  the  symptoms  after  eating  dinner  in their hostel mess. No deaths reported. Community awareness
and health education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  village  Thamiyang,  Sub-District Khimiyang  EAC,  District  Changlang.  Cases  presented  with fever  with rash.  District  RRT  investigated  the outbreak.  Age group of the affected cases were 0-5 years. Cases were treated
symptomatically. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  Village  Pati,  Sub-District  Dolvan, District  Tapi.  Cases  presented  with  fever  with  rash.  3  blood samples  were  collected  and  sent  to  BJMC  Ahmedabad.  1 sample came positive for the Measles IgM by ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Age group of the affected cases were 1-7 years. Cases were treated symptomatically. Vitamin A solution were given to all the cases. Vaccination status is poor among   the   affected.   Community   awareness   and   health
education given by peripheral team on vaccination, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases   were   reported   from   Village   Chilam,   Sub-District Sherghati, District Gaya. Cases presented with fever with rash. 2 blood samples were collected and sent to AIIMS Patna. Both samples came positive for the Measles IgM by ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Age group of the affected cases was  2yrs,  3  yrs  and  10  yrs.  Cases  treated  symptomatically. Vitamin A solution was given to susceptible one. Community
awareness  and  health  education  given  by peripheral  team  on vaccination, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  Village  Jora,  Sub-District  Raipur, and District Raipur. Cases presented with loose stools. 7 stool samples and 3 water samples were collected and sent to Hamar Lab Pandri, Raipur.  Stool samples did not show growth of any pathogenic  organism.  All  the  water  samples  found  fit  for potable purpose. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were   treated   symptomatically.   Community   awareness   and
health  education  given  by  peripheral  team  on  hygiene  and sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  UPHC-3  Rabarivas,  Sub-District Palanpur,  District  Banas  Kantha.  Cases  presented  with  loose stools  and  vomiting.  30  stool  samples  were  collected  and BMCRI. Two samples found positive for Cholera. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. One death occurred in this outbreak. Community awareness and health  education  given  by  peripheral  team  on  hygiene  and
sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  Tauni  Devi  CH,     Sub-District Hamirpur,   District   Hamirpur.   Cases   presented   with   loose stools. 9 rectal swabs and 12 water samples were collected and sent  to  Dr  RK  GMC  Hamirpur.  Rectal  swabs  did  not  show growth of any pathogenic organism and 4 water samples found unfit   for   potable   purpose.   District   RRT   investigated   the outbreak.  Cases  were  treated  symptomatically.  Community awareness  and  health  education  given  by peripheral  team  on
hygiene and sanitation.

Unnamed: 1: The Dadra And Nagar Haveli And Daman And Diu

Unnamed: 8:
Cases   were   reported   from   Village   Upperu,   Sub-District Kukunoor,  District  Eluru.  Cases  presented  with  loose  stools, pain  abdomen  and  vomiting.  District  RRT  investigated  the outbreak.  Cases  were  treated  symptomatically.  78  years  old female expired on 15-05-2024 due to co morbid heart disease. Another   case,   8   year   old   boy   expired   on   15-05-2024.
Community   awareness   and    health   education    given    by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Unnamed: 1: The Dadra And Nagar Haveli And Daman And Diu

Unnamed: 8:
Cases were reported from Village Wessang, Sub-District Seppa HQ, District East Kameng. Cases presented with complaints of hydrophobia,  fever  and  discomfort.  History  of  dog  bite  5-6 months   back.   They   did   not   receive   ARV.   District   RRT investigated  the  outbreak.  37  year  old  male  expired  on  16th February  while  52  year  old  male  expired  on  24th  February 2024.  Community  awareness  and  health  education  given  by
peripheral  team  on  vaccination  for  dog  bite,  hygiene  and sanitation.

Cases  were reported from Sub-District Rajnandgaon, District Rajnandgaon. Cases presented with fever with maculo-papular rash.  District  RRT  investigated  the  outbreak.  Cases  were treated  symptomatically.  Community  awareness  and  health
education given by peripheral team on vaccination, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Hivrem and Golaulim, Sub-District Satari, District North Goa. Case presented with fever, headache with  generalized  weakness. 65  blood  samples  were collected and  sent  to  DPHL  North  Goa.  6  Samples  came  positive  for Kyasanur  Forest  Disease  (KFD)  Virus  by  RT-PCR.  District RRT investigated the outbreak. Age group of the affected cases were 35-50 years. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene
and sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  Sub-District  Tirurangadi,  District Malappuram.   Cases   presented   with   vomiting   and   pain abdomen. 9 food samples and 1 water sample were collected and  sent  to  Regional  Analytical  Lab,  Kozhikode.  2  food samples found unsatisfactory, while water sample found fit for potable   purpose.   District   RRT   investigated   the   outbreak. Children  from 9  different  Schools  came  to  write  an  exam  at GMUPS  Kannamangalam.  Cases  developed  the  symptoms after having their lunch.  Cases were treated symptomatically. Community   awareness   and    health   education    given    by
peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  Sub-district  Wazirganj,  District Gaya. Cases presented with fever with rash. 6 blood samples were collected and sent to AIIMS Patna. All 6 blood samples came  positive  for  the  Measles  IgM  by ELISA.  District  RRT investigated  the  outbreak.  Age  group  of  the  affected  cases were 2-5 years. Cases were treated symptomatically. Vitamin A  solution  were  given  to  them.  Community  awareness  and
health  education  given  by  peripheral  team  on  vaccination, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases   reported   from   Basar   Township   under   DH   Basar, Leparada District.  Cases presented with fever with rash. Total 19 serum & throat swab samples were collected & sent to WHO laboratory, out of which 1 sample came positive for Rubella and 1 for Measles by IgM ELISA. Age group of the affected cases was 10 months to 6 years. Vitamin A solution and symptomatic treatment were given to the cases. Immunization status of the
cases  was  unknown.  Health  education  was  given  regarding importance of immunization.

Cases were reported from a school under PHC Kuthampully, Village:    Pazhayannur,    Sub-District:    Talappilly,    District: Thrissur. Cases presented with fever with rash. Six throat swab and  serum  samples  were  taken  from  suspected  scarlet  fever cases   and   sent   to   Department   of   Microbiology,   Thrissur Medical   College.   Throat   culture   of   one   sample   showed presence  of  Streptococcus  Pyogenes.  ASO  titer  of  another patient also showed positive. Total 8 serum samples & 2 throat swab in VTM for measles & rubella were collected & sent to NIV  Alappuzha,  all  samples  were  negative.  District  RRT
investigated  the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and  health education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  PHC  Hatod  (Hatod),  Sub-District: Hatod,  District:  Indore.  Cases  presented  with  symptoms  of fever and rash. All the cases were diagnosed clinically. District RRT  investigated  the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and health  education  given  by  peripheral  team  on  hygiene  and
sanitation.

Cases   were   reported   from   CH   Petlawad,   Sub-District: Petlawad, District: Jhabua. Cases presented with symptoms of fever  with  rash,  cough,  and  watery  eye.  Total  7
samples were sent for testing, out of which 6 were found to be positive   for   Anti-   Measles   IgM   ELISA.   District   RRT investigated  the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and  health
education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  District  Hospital  Thoubal,  PHC Leisangthem, Village: Lumkseh, Sub-District: Lilong, District: Thoubal. Cases presented with symptoms of fever and rash. The affected age group was 1-14 years. Total 5 blood samples were sent to RIMS (Regional Institute of Medical Sciences, Imphal), all  5  were  positive  for  measles  (IgM  ELISA).  District  RRT
investigated  the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and  health education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from PHC Sangaiyumpham, Sub-District: Thoubal, District: Thoubal. Cases presented with symptoms of fever and rash. The affected  age group  was 11  months to 11 years. Ten blood samples were sent to RIMS (Regional Institute of Medical Sciences, Imphal), out of which 7 were positive for measles (IgM ELISA). District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community   awareness   and    health   education    given    by
peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Diengpasoh PHC, Village: Lumkseh, Sub-District: Mawryngkneng, District: East Khasi Hills. Cases presented  with  symptoms  of  fever  with  fever,  rash,  cough, coryza  and  conjunctivitis.  Majority  of  the  cases  were  un- vaccinated  against  MR.  Total  4  serum  and  1  throat  swab samples were collected & sent to WHO NPSP, Shillong region. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on hygiene and
sanitation.

Case  reported  from  Charbatapara  II,  Phulbari  PHC,  Selsalla Block. Case presented with symptoms of vomiting, aerophobia, muscle   spasm,   hydrophobia,   nausea,   anxiety,   dysphagia, delerium, aggressiveness. The deceased was bitten by unknown stray dog. The dog was found dead on the riverbank one week after the incident.  Case  was clinically confirmed  as a human rabies case. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey was done for any dog bite cases. IEC activities regarding wound washing, wood management, importance of ARV  in  animal  bite  condition  and  completing  the  vaccine schedule  was  conducted.  Contact  tracing  done  and  exposure prophylaxis started for all the close contacts. Death of a 14 year old male has occurred due to the illness. The deceased did not take  the  Anti-Rabies  vaccine  however  his  four  close  contact family members took ARV after his death and all of them have
taken 3 doses of ARV.

Cases  were  reported  from  Village  Bhakurahar  Sital,  Sub- District Lalganj, District Vaishali. Cases presented with fever with  rash.  Age  group  of  the  affected  cases  were  2-10  years. District    RRT    investigated    the    outbreak.    Cases    treated symptomatically.   Vitamin   A   solution   given   to   the   cases.
Community   awareness   and    health   education    given    by peripheral team on vaccination, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases   were   reported   from   Parwanoo   ESI   Hospital,   Sub- District:  Kasauli,  District:  Solan.  Cases  are  presented  with diarrhea.  All  age  groups  were  affected.  Three  stool  samples were collected & sent to ESI Parwanoo, which showed growth of Shigella species on culture. Total 100 water samples were sent  to  CTL  (Composite  Testing  Laboratory)  Kandaghat,  Jal Shakti Vibhag, HPPCB Lab Parwanoo, out of which 38 showed presence  of  E.coli.  District  RRT  investigated  the  outbreak. Community   awareness   and    health   education    given    by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation. The outbreak might
be  caused  by  consumption  of  contaminated  water  in  River Kaushalya due to open sewerage.

Cases   were   reported   from   Village   Damudi,   Gosaoidih Piparkudar    and    Ranichirka    Sub-District    Chandankiyari, District  Bokaro.  Cases  presented  with  fever  with  rash.  Age group of the affected cases were 1-12 years. Six blood samples were collected and sent to RIMS, Ranchi, out of which 3 were positive for Measles IgM by ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. Vitamin A solution  were  given  to  the  cases.  Community  awareness  and health  education  given  by  peripheral  team  on  vaccination,
hygiene and sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  a  primary  school  of  Madanpur, Topchanchi, Sub-District Topchanchi, District Dhanbad. Cases presented  with  parotid  gland  swelling,  fever  and  sore  throat. Affected cases were below the age of 13 years. All cases were clinically  diagnosed.  District  RRT  investigated  the  outbreak. Cases  were  treated  symptomatically.  Community  awareness
and health education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases   were   reported   from   Village   Ranitand,   Sub-District Gande, District Giridih. Cases presented with fever with fluid filled  rash.  Four  blood  samples  were  collected  and  sent  to DPHL  Giridih,  out  of  which  3  were  positive  for  Varicella Zoster  Virus  IgM  by  ELISA.  District  RRT  investigated  the outbreak.  Cases  were  treated  symptomatically.  Community awareness  and  health  education  given  by peripheral  team  on
hygiene and sanitation.

Cases   were  reported   from   FHC  Thekkumkara,   Ward   18, Village:   Thekkumkara,   Sub-District:   Talappilly,   District: Thrissur.  Cases  presented  with  symptoms  of  fever,  fatigue, nausea and abdominal pain. Total 8 samples were sent to Govt Medical College Thrissur, all were positive for Anti-HAV IgM by ELISA and 19 cases were epidemiologically linked. District RRT  investigated  the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and health  education  given  by  peripheral  team  on  hygiene  and
sanitation.

Case  was  reported  from  Bansal  Hospital,  CD  Bagsewaniya, Sub-District:  Huzur,  District:  Bhopal.  Case  presented  with symptoms of vomiting (coffee colored), decreased appetite and weakness. One blood sample was collected & tested at Bansal Hospital  which  was  positive  for  Leptospirosis.  District  RRT investigated  the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and  health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene  and  sanitation.  Death  of  an  87  year  old  female  has
occurred due to the illness.

Cases were reported from Sub-District Piro, District Bhojpur. Cases presented with fever with rash. Age group of the affected cases were 3-8 years. Total 4 serum samples were collected and sent to AIIMS, Patna, out of which 3 samples came positive for Measles   IgM   by   ELISA.   District   RRT   investigated   the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. Vit. A solution was given to the at risk age group. Community awareness and
health  education  given  by  peripheral  team  on  immunization, hygiene and sanitation.

Case  was  reported  from  GMCH  Manjeri,  Village:  Manjeri, Sub-District:  Ernad,  District:  Malappuram.  A  2  years  old female presented with headache, tiredness associated with fever with chills on 27/02/2024. One CSF sample was collected and sent  to  MCH  Calicut  which  was  positive  for  WNF  IgM  by ELISA  on  16/03/24.  District  RRT  investigated  the  outbreak. Community   awareness   and    health   education    given    by
peripheral  team  on  vector  control  measures,  hygiene  and sanitation.

Cases were reported from a school under PHC Iringallur, Sub- District:  Tirurangadi,  District:  Malappuram.  Cases  presented with  fever,  abdominal  pain,  headache  and  vomiting.  All  the affected cases had a history of attending a food fest event one month ago. The affected age group was 5-30 years. Two blood samples were sent to DPHL Malappuram, both were positive for  HAV  IgM  by ELISA.  One  water  sample  was  also  tested which showed presence of coliforms. District RRT investigated
the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and  health  education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases  were  reported  from  TMM  Thiruvalla,  Village:  Adoor, Sub-District: Adoor, District: Pathanamthitta. Cases presented with  fever  with  rash.  One  vesicle  swab  was  sent  to  NIV Alapuzha,  which  was positive for Varicella by PCR. District RRT  investigated  the  outbreak.  Community  awareness  and health  education  given  by  peripheral  team  on  hygiene  and
sanitation.
